Reviews.Title: “Great Location; modern appartments”
Reviews.Author: AC_BCN
Reviews.Content: I found this place for my parents who wanted to come over to Barcelona during Semana Santa. It is from far one of the nicest place we could find: modern appartments, well equiped, modern decoration & security guards in the lobby of the building. I give only 3 bubbles as the room was located on C/ Marina and was a bite noisy. My parents had to use hear plugs to sleep... also bins were not emptied everyday... All in all good place to stay even if a bit overpriced for the services you get.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: jquinn887
Reviews.Content: First off, very simple to get here from the airport. Just take the A1 or A2 bus, depending on the terminal you are at (which cost 5,30 euro one-way), and get off at Plaza de Catalunya where you can catch a train, or what I found easier to avoid transferring was walking to Passeig de Gracia and catch the (purple) line there to Sagrada Familia. Once there just walk toward the KFC, and up the street which is to the left of the split where the gas station is. NOTE: Traveled with my girlfriend and we decided to buy 10-ride metro cards (~9 euro) which we both could use as we needed, instead of spending ~23 euro/each for a 4-day unlimited. This ended up working out in our favor as we ended up purchasing the 10-ride card three times, therefore saving a substantial amount. Got to the apartments around 11:00 am, earlier than the check-in time but they told me they would have a room ready within a half hour so we went to a small restaurant down the block to have some jamon bocadillos. Once we were done the room was ready and I definitely did not expect what I saw upon entering the room. I had compared prices and locations of many hotels and this seemed around the average price for 4-nights and in a nice area, but to walk into a 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment with complete kitchen, dining table, living area and patio was definitely excessive but we were definitely not complaining. NOTE: There is a limit on the hot water usage when taking showers; however, I never did reach this limit. I believe it was a liter-measured limit, which will reset 30 minutes after it has been reached. So i suppose you should not take hour-long showers, but dont let that steer you away from such a great apartment/hotel. There was someone at the front desk at all hours. Internet is an extra charge (unless you have it included); but it was only about 4-5 euro/day which is not bad; but, we never felt the need to use it and even found some wifi spots around the city for our phones, one randomly up in montjuic. Apartment was very modern and had soaps, towels, blow-dryer and a safe in the bedroom. There is a supermarket right on the corner which is open rather late and sells pastries and food which we decided to purchase to save some money and make our own food to kick off the day. Sagrada Familia is just down the street, and can be seen from the apartments; definitely a sight to take in and one that you will be seeing everytime you arrive back at the apartment to call it a day. This is the #1 place I recommend all to stay at and will return, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Position, Position, Position”
Reviews.Author: bettyboopinv
Reviews.Content: Minutes from the Sagrada Familia and Metro, what more could one want? Well, whatever you want the suites have it. Excellent sized unit of 2 bedrooms, lounge, dining, kitchen fairly well fitted out. Informative reception staff. Yes, outlook is a not a feature, but time was not sufficient to dwell on this as Barcelona has so much to offer and the transport to get there keeps one our all day. Housekeeping is fairly good, but as the floors are marble with no entry mats, a lot of dirt is walked in, I would suggest more concentration on floor cleaning (especially behind doors where dirt gathers) so guests do not have to leave shoes on to feel comfortable. Several grocery shops now in the area, including a Carrefors and there is a great buffet restaurant opposite the Sagrada at 9.90 Euro including drinks and dessert for lunch. No street noise, and two rooms to each entry ensures no guest noise travels. My grandson and I liked this property very much.

Reviews.Title: “loved”
Reviews.Author: Ediciukas
Reviews.Content: travelled with a friend- no complaints. great location, spacious, clean and modern appartament. would thoroughly recomend

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: MarNovNewtown_PA
Reviews.Content: The apartment is very clean and new. The bedrooms are rather small but the leaving room is a good size. The kitchen has everything you may need except of a coffee maker. The apartment is very close to the metro station. A small grocery shop is one block down the street. The best thing was that we couldn't hear any street noise in our bedrooms. We paid for the internet connection but it wasn't very good. Overall it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: When I seen the price of this I expected something to be wrong but there wasn't! Although we did not have a good view that was a small complaint and also they could have provided an iron. But for location it is perfect..beside a subway line, beside the segreda familla (which you can get tourist bus from) and also if you feel like fast food the is KFC, Burger King, MacDonalds and a pizzeria all within a block. Oh and also for a place known for pickpockets, it's not as bad as people say, just be aware in busy places and you will be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JyTy
Reviews.Content: Apartaments Marina are located near Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, a minute walk from subway station. We liked the apartments very much. Clean, spacey and very affordable. The only thing missing was free Wi-Fi access point for hotel guests but I guess you can't have it all ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Barcelona - more spacious for less money”
Reviews.Author: Thedarks
Reviews.Content: I had a business conference in Barcelona and stayed here for pleasure four days before the conference thanks to tripadvisor. This was a wonderful choice for many reasons: - Location: 2 blocks from Sagrada Familia, a metro station and the "hop on- hop off" tourist buses. Better yet, we found better shopping and restaurants here in the Eixample district than in the main tourist and shopping drag downtown. - Size: Don't know actual square footage, but it felt like a 900 sq ft. apartment. Modern, spotlessly clean, and very comfortable. - Price: well below hotel choices of comparable quality. - Other Pros: kitchen let us cook our own breakfast which was very useful as Barcelona was not a big breakfast town, and we were battling jet lag from California. Nearby markets were handy with a good enough selection of food and a short walk led to great food shopping. Also, I can highly recommend the nearby restaurant "Los Bellota" for the best quality food. The desk staff were helpful and all spoke english well. Note that the desk was manned 24/7, but it is an apartment, not a hotel, so don't expect a concierge. Nonetheless, the staff gave us great recommendations on where to eat, and the checkout time was good. The balcony had great urban views, and yet it was quiet when everything was closed. - Cons: The kitchen could have had a few more items - like a cutting board and a larger pan, even a sponge. Wifi was not free, but was fast and relatively cheap, especially when compared to hotels that charge more for slower speeds. Other notes: they had no iron or ironing board, contrary to what their site said. They do have a coffee maker in every kitchen, but it's the "bialetta" stovetop espresso maker, so if you're not used to that (I have one at home) then you may not realize what it is. Bring some Starbucks Via if that's an issue for you. They do have a little washbasin for cleaning clothes, but no drying line that I saw. After 4 days here, I checking into the Hotel Princesa Sofia for my conference. What a disappointment after having the space and comfort of a real apartment, and the Marina was more than 50 Euros a night less.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 5 people, and it was comfortable. We had a 2 bedroom apartment on the 4th floor, and it was well appointed, clean and comfortable which is all we could ask. I can't comment on cooking facilities as we ate at one of the nearby restaurants each night. We found the apartments well located, not far to the metro station, and as it is close to Sagrada Familia surrounded by a large number of eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Taksidiaris
Reviews.Content: Marina appartaments really felt like home. We had a 2 room flat which was really spacious! Also it is very clean and the location is almost ideal. Do not expect though any special design or room service. If you want to stay in a large flat without paying a fortune then i fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Tano
Reviews.Content: Our 7 night stay in this appartment was a very good experience. We (2 adults & 2 teenagers) were provided with a first floor appartment which was clean, spacious and was serviced every day. The location is very close to Sagrada Familia and we used to walk pass it every day of our vacation. The appartment had a small entrance, a good sitting room with TV, a small kitchenette and two separate bedrooms. All the stations on the TV were in Spanish or Catalan, but we did not mind this as one of our aims was to have more exposition to the Spanish language. What we would recommend is for the kitchenette to have a few more utensils such a kettle, and some basics such as kitchen towel, oil, salt and pepper. Internet had to be paid for at 4 euro for 24hours service.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Europhile23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two places in Barcelona and this one was much more convenient. The area is lovely, residential and safe, important for female travelers. It was close to one of the city's biggest attractions and metro. A convenience store and coffee shop/bakery is also nearby. I preferred this apartment to the hotel we stayed at since it was much more spacious, has a balcony and offered privacy. It has a tasteful decor and was clean. Our suite was in the front and it was noisy at night. The front desk service was spotty depending on the attendant on duty. No hand soap and other items like coffee pots usually found at home. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “None of the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: TrolleyCorral
Reviews.Content: No coffee pot, no jug, no washing machine,no kitchen sponge, no handsoap, no interest from the front desk. Not really a self-contained holiday apartment, more an adjunct to their Parking lot, whose customers take precedence.

Reviews.Title: “All good- Location, facility, price”
Reviews.Author: phlip0830
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of Tripadvisor ranking and it was a nice choice. First of all, this hotel is just a minute walk from Sagrada Familia, the most famous spot in Barcelona. Metro is also there. It is, as its title indicates, not a hotel, but an apartment. Large two bedroom, fully faciliated kitchen, and spacious living room- All modern, newly equipped. At the price below $100, it is a real steal. Reserve this hotel directly from their homepage. (There is a promo 0f 5% off)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: squirtit_green
Reviews.Content: Situated about 200m from the Sagrada Familia and the same distance from a mainline metro station these are well placed apartments for travelling around Barcelona. Check in was a little lengthy but this was likely a one off due to a booking hitch with other guests and the counter staff also acting as car park attendants for a paid underground car park, very odd. The 3 person room was around the back so had no views to speak of, it was however very clean, air conditioned, modern, stylish and it had a balcony. Two well sized bedrooms, a large kitchen and living/dining area were all excellent. There are two small supermarkets in the block and within 100m of the apartments so getting milk/bread/juice for breakfast is easy. The apartment is well worth the money, we saved about 25% on the advertised price by using Trip Advisor, we will return to Barcelona and stay here again. My visiting Barcelona tip is to avoid the taxi drivers, they'll add all sorts of extras to bump up the price. Get a family metro pass with almost unlimited travel, 3 people for 4 days is a total of 45 euros we never had to wait more than 3 mins for a train.......and go to the market it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: ErnestineWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Booked Apartaments Marina based on good reviews on Trip Advisor. Not disappointed. Very comfortable apartment with balcony views of Sagrada Familia. Kitchen was useful for making basic meals but could do with having more crockery (deeper bowls for cereal and larger cups for tea!) and also a corkscrew / bottle opener. Staff were very helpful and we felt safe in the area. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and stay again”
Reviews.Author: borgir72
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to metro. The room was clean and well equipped, the bed comfy. The staff was friendly, very good english, helpful to give us much information, maps... and made our stay wonderful. Thanks to the staff and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “'washing facilities' is a small hand basin- and it's on the balcony!”
Reviews.Author: princesspea01
Reviews.Content: The website I booked from said this place had washing facilities which with a family was on my lists of must haves for our week in Barcelona. However when I got there I found that it was a small hand basin located on the balcony! I expect a quad apartment to have washing facilities! It could also be cleaner- the bed spreads etc

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space, great location, kitchen, quiet, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Tantanna
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days in Barcelona with my 15 yr old daughter and was very impressed by Apartaments Marina. Was expecting one room with a kitchenette in the corner so was very suprised to find a big sitting-dining room, 2 bedrooms, bathroom and kitchen. Had been planning to stay in a budget hotel but decided to pay just a little bit more and cook for ourselves rather than eat out every meal. Found this was very good value and much more relaxing. The apartments are a few minutes walk from Gaudi's Sagrada Familia and the metro. Not in the middle of Barcelona but quite central on the metro and in a safe, family area. We liked it more than staying in the hectic centre. Barcelona isn't huge so it is only 15 mins or so on the metro into the the Ramblas. Lots of shops all around to buy essentials - supermarkets, fruit and vegetable shops, bakeries and lots of restuarants and cafes. Enjoyed going to the Boulangerie next door to buy pastries for breakfast each day. We had rooms at the back which was really quiet. The front is probably bit more more noisy although it's not a main road. Cleaners came in every day and put the dishwasher on and staff at the desk were extremely helpful. All very clean and friendly. A great choice for families or people who want a bit of quiet space. Can't think of anywhere better to stay in a city and would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could be cleaner and more secure!”
Reviews.Author: Murlin100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights for sightseeing in Barcelona. Location was good, metro nearby. Parking available right next door for 21 euro per day. Cooking facilities available, but nothing to clean with, wipe down tables etc, no dishwashing powder. Room was serviced daily, and dishwasher turned on by cleaner, but would have liked at least a tea towel and cloth to wipe down benches and table etc. We ended up using a towel. Bedrooms had good black out curtains. Our main negative was the cleaning staff left 3 windows open and the ranch slider open when we had left it closed and secure. Our apartment was on ground level as well. When we queried it at the front desk they said they always leave them open a little for air circulation. We were not impressed. Cleaning was not good. Upon arrival glass tables were smeary, and toilet and vanity had marks on. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: shambolin
Reviews.Content: Have just reurned a few hours ago from Barcelona and I think we made a good choice with these apartments. Easy to find, very near a metro station and a view of the Sagrada Famillia from the balcony! What more can you ask? There are a few supermarkets nearby for your supplies, but the ones up the road on the left (and round the corner) are cheaper than the one a few doors down from the apartments. That said, very convenient! The staff couldn't have been more helpful, giving us a map and offering advice on things to see and do during our stay. Loved every minute of it and sorry that we couldn't stay longer. However we did manage to fit in a tour of Montserrat (excellent - a place I'd definately want to go to again), winery tour (very good cava), Nou Camp, Sagrada Famillia, Parc Guell, Casa Mila, Poblet Espanyol, Olympic stadium, cable cars and lunch by the beach. My son loved it all and wants to go back in a few years to see how they're getting on with the church!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, modern, convenient”
Reviews.Author: JPIowa
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days at Apartments Marina with my wife and four year old son. The hotel has apartments that include a full kitchen (stovetop, microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator, freezer), a living/dining room with a flatscreen tv, a full bathroom with a tub, and in our case two bedrooms. Our apartment also had a balcony with views of the Sagrada Familia cathedral. We also had access to a private patio. The apartment was clean, with modern furniture. Having a full kitchen at our disposal meant that we could cook for our four year old, which was very useful. There are at least four supermarkets, a few grocery stores and a couple of bakeries within two blocks of the hotel, so it was easy to get "supplies". Even though the hotel is a block from Sagrada Familia, the neighborhood is largely residential and away from the large crowds you will find downtown. The metro is a block away, giving you easy access to all of Barcelona. The hotel staff was very friendly, especially a young man who seemed to work mostly in the morning. The beds were comfortable, and the windows have blinds that completely block the sunlight, helping you get a better night of sleep. Before you pay for high speed Internet, check for free wifi. We were able to get it from who knows what source in the living room of our apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: munchkins7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked this property based on the TripAdvisor Reviews and we were not disappointed. Ramon, who checked us in, was friendly, efficient and a wealth of information about the area and the city. He could not have been more helfpul or patient, even when I asked questions in my very bad Spanish. I would recommend not going to the OpenCor on the corner, instead going up the hill. The feel is a lot more neighborhoody. A great boulangerie, fruit/vegetable stand and a cheaper supermarket. Our apartment was comfortable, roomy and efficient. The property is not in the center of town, but we actually liked getting away from the crowds after a long day!! Felt as if we were truly going "home". Loved the gates that came down which added an extra layer of security. Beds a tad hard. Terrace view of Sagrada Familia was nice to enjoy in the morning with tea and in the evening with a glass of wine. Also liked being in the hustle and bustle of a real neighborhood. Nice restaurants within walking distance. I would highly recommend taking in the Magic Fountain, held at the Palau Nacional at Placa Espanya! Just be careful to mind your belongings! Can be a pickpocket haven! Am already planning my next trip to Barcelona and will definitely be staying at Apartaments Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value within sight of Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: Afton_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Marina Apartments in March 2010. The apartments are in a safe neighborhood within 2 blocks of the Metro and several buses. Our apt. was clean, the bed was firm and it was quiet with the window closed. The apartments are serviced and cleaned each day. Plenty of dishware and cutlery but very few pots and pans. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ZacharyS
Reviews.Content: Granted it's not in the absolute heart of the city, but if your not scared of public transit who cares. I loved this place, very comfortable, very clean, and within easy walking distance of the subway system. There are several grocery stores relativly close to the apartment that we slowly found over our 4 night stay. We try and stay in apartments when we are on vacation so I can compare it easily to other places we have stayed and based on value, comfort and cleanlyness it's above average, what was maybe lacking was some language variety on the TV, some extra appliances in the kitchen (toaster), and maybe some maps to grocery stores or good restraunts in the area - i always find this very helpful when staying in neighborhoods not well documented by Lonely Planet or other guiedes. Kind of picky stuff, but still loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Apartments!”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: The Apartaments are located within sight of the Sagrada Familia-- we had a view from our deck. The price was perfect for an in-city apartment. We couldn't get the wifi to work but there was an internet cafe on the corner. We actually got stuck in Barcelona for 2 extra nights and thankfully they had room! There is also an OpenCor grocery on the other corner which made self-catering a breeze! Units were very spacious for Europe with 2 bedrooms and a decent sized bath and kitchen. Also a very nice sized living room. The TV only had 1 English channel - CNBC of all things! :) No breakfast or anything included but there are lots of cafes with 2 EUR coffee + pastry specials all around. Definitely great location and would definitely stay again and really makes me want to do an apartment more often. Easy to get to Metro and walking to Diagonal/Pg. de Gracia only 15 minutes away on foot!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, plenty of space and great value!”
Reviews.Author: crookedbarn
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I went on a quick weekend getaway to Barcelona and were more then pleased with the room/apt. We booked late so they only had the triple left, but it was still a great bargain compared to other hotels. Nice small kitchen, living room and very sparce, but clean bedroom with comfortable bed. One block away from the church and metro. You can pay for WIFI, but it wasn't working when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LindaHug54
Reviews.Content: Ideally located, friendly staff and very helpful. All amenities close by.Very clean, heard no noise. Some noise from street but not excessive just traffic.Will definately return.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: le_Franglais
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apartaments Marina in late October for 3 nights. The Apartaments are easy to find from the Sagrada Familia Metro station - about 100 metres away. We were warmly welcomed on arrival although it took ages for the reception to check our passport details and for what reason I wasn't entirely sure. Also, we had to pay the full cost of our stay on arrival. This was a surprise as I don't recall being advised of this when making the reservation. As with most debit and credit card transactions in Spain you are offered the options to pay in £ Sterling or Euros. If you are from the UK chose £ Sterling as the exchange rate the card processing company applies are not good. Once in the room we were pleasantly surprised at how spacious and clean it was - with one exception being some hair round the bath plug hole! The 2 bedrooms were adequately sized as was the bathroom and the lounge area was very spacious. The kitchen was reasonably well equipped - look out for the cleaning kit with a cloth and washing up liquid. However, the ceramic hob was past its best and the controls were a bit tempremental but OK once sussed out. The room was serviced every day with fresh towels and a clean of the kitchen. The air con was good although we switched it off as we had the windows and balcony door open - the weather was that good even in late October! The rooms facing the front are noisy as Carrer de la Marina is a busy throughfare and this continues into the night but after a short while we aclimatised to this and it wasn't a problem. There are a few food shops nearby but look out for the Eroski supermarket nearby as this is far cheaper and has a wider range than the more immediate shops. The best bar/cafe we found was in Avinguda de Gaudí - sit outside and take it the wonder of the Sagrada Familia as the night falls - and get a plate of tapas with your apertitif - Superb! Overall, I would recommend staying here but make sure you have enough to pay the bill on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great appartments”
Reviews.Author: LOH
Reviews.Content: very roomy - we stayed 5 adults in one appartment with no problems

Reviews.Title: “Clean, roomy, great value and location”
Reviews.Author: GCake1105
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time finding an affordable bargain hotel in Barcelona in early September but I booked this one based on reviews and was surprised! First off, the location was great, it is off of the Sagrada Familia metro line just a block away, very easy to locate and a very short walk. The price was 243 euros for 3 nights, about 80 euros per night. When we first went in the front doors to the building we thought the front desk was the parking attendant and that was true, we were taken aback at his small booth. We were asked to pay up front and had to provide passport information they would send to the police (typically required in Europe although not always enforced). Our room was on the 5th floor, and it was huge compared to what we had been used to in Spain since we had a full kitchen, a living room/dining room, a bathroom, one room w/ a double bed and one room w/ a single bed which we did not ask for and also did not use. The place has a contemporary IKEA type decor, with dishes and pots and pans but not much more. Central air conditioning was awesome! Had a TV with very limited channels, no DVD player. Has a balcony with shutters to keep out the sun. Provides limited items such as shampoo, soap, shower gel. No dishwasher soap because the housekeeping runs in the dishwasher every day after you leave if you put dishes inside. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, clean, well located, a bit spartan”
Reviews.Author: Packyourbags
Reviews.Content: Our family of myself, my husband and two teens stayed here for 5 nights at 162 euros/night. I picked it based on its TA ranking and also checked out the neighborhood with Google Maps street view. I would recommend this hotel. I initially had some reservations (sorry about the pun!) but the place grew on me. Here are some pros, cons and general info. From airport - I emailed the hotel several times to ask advice on this and didn't hear back for quite a while. I finally had a friend who speaks Spanish call. Turns out that the email link on the website doesn't go directly to the hotel but to the booking agency who had not forwarded it. Here is the email address to use: [--]. We traveled by taxi for 30 euros. Our bags didn't make it so it would have been a bit more if they had. Location - It was a bit removed from some sights but I was happy with it. It is just a couple of blocks from the Sagrada Familia so there was a metro stop right there. AND it made it very easy to locate on our maps as we were navigating around. The area was a mix of residential and business. We ate dinner outside, or had ice cream, several times on the street one block over, with the Sagrada Familia in the background surrounded by a mix that was heavier on the locals than tourists, it seemed. There is a good sized grocery store on the same block, down on the corner, which we visited a couple of times a day to pick up bread for breakfast, or snacks, or sodas, etc. Staff - The people at the desk were always very helpful and friendly, answering questions, chatting, providing history info, calling for our taxi, etc. Rooms - Our apartment, which was very clean, was on the 5th floor in the back and overlooked a pretty large area with the backs of other buildings. A street view would have been nice but this was kind of interesting. It was like seeing people’s backyards in a way. The 4 person units are all in the back. There was plenty of room in the living/dining room area (desk, couch, chair, coffee table, some built ins). We ate and played cards at the large glass table. The kitchen was also bigger than expected with a small microwave, small dishwasher, small cook top and large refrigerator. (Great for freezing water bottles overnight and keeping beverages to have at "home.") All the floors were tiled – marble maybe? Could get noisy with the metal chairs. There were doors between the kitchen and the living/dining room area and between the living/dining area and a small hall that the bedrooms and bathroom opened to. That would be good for families with small children who go to bed before the adults. There was a large balcony in the back and a tiny additional balcony off the kitchen that overlooked a small interior courtyard. All the rooms, but particularly the bedrooms, were pretty spartan. The room with 2 twins didn't have much extra space. Our double was actually 2 twins pushed together - a little uncomfortable if you ended up on the "junction", but not horrible. Each bedroom had a built-in closet with ample hanging space and several drawers inside. The twin room also had a small set of shelves. There were no clocks, phones, TVs, dressers, or lamps in the bedrooms. Amenities - Pretty sparse. My daughter referred to the shampoo and body wash as “sauce packages.” There were plenty of dishes in the kitchen but nothing like soap, towels, detergent, paper towels, napkins, etc., in case you wanted to actually cook. However, maybe that is available if you ask for them. There was a phone in the living/dining room area but no information about the hotel, who to contact, info about the surroundings, etc. There was a TV in the living/dining room with a few stations. The AC was great with an in-room thermostat. A sign in the bathroom talked about conserving water and the 100 liter tank for hot water – we never ran out. All in all we were pleased with this hotel. It wasn’t luxurious but clean and modern, friendly, well located, and roomy. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay!”
Reviews.Author: everfair
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Barcelona for 4 nights. I chose this hotel and booked a air/hotel package though europeandestinations.com. Because we were staying for more than a couple nights, we wanted a place where we could stretch out and feel more homey. This place did the trick! We arrived around 10AM but our room wasn't ready for check-in. We were able to stow our luggage with the hotel and go out to see some sights. The next street over is Gaudi, and it's really cool because down one end you can see La Sagrada Familia, and the other end is the Hospital of Sant Pau. Both worth seeing/exploring! After lunch, check in was no problem and quick. We were impressed with our unit for sure! Because of the layout of the unit, this really felt like it could be an apartment and not just an extended stay hotel. The kitchen was convenient but we didn't cook (only used to the fridge to hold water, beer, and cheese). The OpenCor convenience mart was good to pick up whatever we needed, and if you were to walk a few blocks, there were other supermarkets as well. The pros: lots of space to stretch out. The living room/sitting area was nice and the sofa was very comfortable. I loved the balcony overlooking the street! We were on the 5th floor and had glorious views of La Sagrada Familia, especially early in the morning. The location of the hotel is great! The metro is nearby and made it easy to get around. I just loved walking to the metro and seeing La Sagrada Familia...that something so beautiful was just in full plain view as we were going about our day! Cons: Just one...the beds are very hard. My husband and I are pretty easy to please, but these beds were firm to the point of being uncomfortable. We grabbed the extra pillow from the other room and the sofa cushions and made do. We had a great trip and Apartaments Marina made us feel at home. We felt like we blended in pretty well and could see ourselves living in the neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “excellent for cheap stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: designloverFlanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this place for 5 nights: price early booking through Bookings.com was 427 euro, which was excellent value for money. For that price we had a nice little sitting/dining room with balcony, 2 bedrooms, a kitchen with refrigerator and deepfreezer, dishwasher, oven, microwave, etc. , a nice bathroom. The positive reviews of other travellers describe my own experience, so I won't repeat them. Just one further piece of advice. When you arrive at the stop Sagrada Familia by metro L5, take the exit Parc Gaudi - when you arrive by metro L2 take the exit Provença : coming onto the street you will see Pizza Hut on the corner. Marina is on the street to your left, going up, just 1,5 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice sanctuary to come home in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mooshi007
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at this apartment with a friend of mine ( 2 women) from July 11th to July 19th, and found the place clean simple but adequate modern and well located. The receptionists both are nice and helpful, the apartment has got all the amenities needed except kitchen might need more for a family, though for 2 of us was good enough.It is a 2 bedroom apartment so we both had our separate beds and a great clean bathroom . Cleaning people come everyday however our bed sheets were changed only once, and i found stains on one from before though it was clean.The air condition was a big plus as during our stay Barcelona was very hot and humid. As the others had already mentioned , it is very close to Sagrada Familia, the metro , tourism info and bus touristic. I absolutely recommend this place and it is coded 2 star but can be considered 3 or even 3.1/2 .For the price only tip, better to reserve through their own website as you will get better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartments, great location”
Reviews.Author: iz687
Reviews.Content: These are really great apartments in an excellent location. It's just a few minutes walk from the Sagrada Familia, which is really handy if you're doing the Bus Turistic because it stops there. The area is pretty decent. There's a nice square where you can have a drink and look at the Sagrada Familia all lit up at night. The apartments are very clean and modern looking. Everything looks like it's been put in pretty recently. It's really handy to have a kitchen although we didn't use it much. The bedrooms are a little basic but perfectly fine. Even in October I was glad we had AC. My only complaint is that the noise from the street can be pretty loud. But it's a city so you'd get that anywhere. Good value for money. Would definitely recommend. We really liked it. PS: There's a really handy little grocery store just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: UCL79
Reviews.Content: This apartment was in an ideal location for us just a block away from a Metro station and the Sagrada Familia. We were impressed with the cleanliness of the place and it had an adequately-equipped kitchen. The staff at the check-in reception desk were very helpful in giving us tourism and restaurant recommendations. There is a small supermarket in the same block which is very convenient.

HotelInfo.Name: Apartaments Marina
HotelInfo.Address: Marina 306, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
